Vlasnik pirejskog Olimpijakosa i engleskog Notingem Foresta kupio sebi TV-stanicu

01 Nov 2019, 12:00

Najstarija grčka privatna TV-stanica, finansijski propala "Mega" (MEGA Channel), prodata je danas grčkom brodovlasniku Vangelisu Marinakisu, vlasniku fudbalskih klubova "Olimpijakos" iz Pireja i engleskog "Notingem Foresta". Pošto je ta nekada ugledna TV kuća s visokokvalitetnim programom ugašena, Marinakis je s 34 miliona evra kupio samo pravo na njen zaštitni znak i platio njenu arhivu.Marinakisova ponuda na jutrošpnjoj licitaciji bila je 33.999.999 evra, jedno nepoznato preduzeće registrovano na Kipru je ponudilo 33.000.000, a treću i poslednju ponudu, od simboličnih pet evra, podneo je advokat grupe zaposlenih "Mege" koji su zbog njene finansijske propasti ostali bez posla.U drugom delu aukcije drugom kupcu je otišao deo nekretnina "Mege" za svega 500.000 evra.Aukciju imovine te TV-kuće su nadgledali predsednica Udruženja novinara Grčke (ESIEA), Marija Antoniadu, predstavnici zaposlenih i stečajni upravnik.Evangelos Marinakis (52), grčki je brodovlasnik, član Gradskog veća Pireja i vlasnik dva fudbalska kluba pirejskog i engelskog. Za sada nije objavljen plan Marinakisa za "Megu"."Mega" je emitovala mešavinu savremenog informativnog programa najvišeg kvaliteta, domaćeg i stranog zabavnog programa, registrovana 1989. godine, kada je u Grčkoj dopušteno postojanje privatnih RTV kanala. Kao prva privatna televizijska stanica koja je počela rad u Grčkoj, emitovanje je počela 20. novembra 1989. Na Atinskoj berzi deonica firme "Tiletipos", vlasnice "Mege", bile su medju najunosnijim od ulaska na tržite akcija 1994. godine, ali je prodaja zbog krize firme trgovina njima odustavljena marta 2016. godine."Mega" je od 2012. imala finansijske probleme s bankama zbog prezaduženosti.Uprava tog TV kanala je tada odlučila da prekine emitovanje vesti i sve emisije uživo i usmerila se isključivo na snimljene sadržaje i reprize.Zemaljsko emitovanje "Mege" je prekinuto odlukom distributera 28. oktobra 2018, a emitovanje na kablovskoj mreži je obustavljeno mesec dana kasnije. Program "Mege" se i dalje emituje putem interneta.
text:
Owner of Piraeus Olympiakos and English Nottingham Forest bought a TV station

01 Nov 2019, 12:00

The oldest privately owned Greek TV station, financially collapsed "Mega" (MEGA Channel), was sold today to Greek shipowner Vangelis Marinakis, owner of Olympiakos football clubs in Piraeus and England's Nottingham Forest. Since that once reputable TV station with a high-quality program was shut down, Marinakis bought only 34 million euros from her trademark right and paid for her archive. Marinakis bid at € 33,999,999 this morning, one unknown company registered in Cyprus offered 33,000,000, and the third and final bid, of a symbolic five euros, was submitted by a lawyer of a group of Mege employees who lost their jobs because of its financial ruin. In the second part of the auction, another part of the "Mege" property went to another buyer for only 500,000 euros .The auction of the property of this TV station was overseen by the President of the Association of Journalists of Greece (ESIEA), Maria Antoniadou, employee representatives and the trustee. Evangelos Marinakis, 52, is a Greek shipowner, a member of the Piraeus City Council and the owner of two Piraeus and English football clubs. No Marinakis plan for "Mega" has been announced so far. "Mega" was broadcasting a mix of a state-of-the-art top-quality news program, both domestic and foreign, registered in 1989, when private broadcasting channels were allowed in Greece. As the first private television station to start operating in Greece, it began broadcasting on November 20, 1989. On the Athens Stock Exchange, the shares of Tiletipos, the owner of "Mega", were among the most lucrative since entering the market in 1994, but sales due to the crisis of the trading company, which was discontinued in March 2016. "Mega" has been having financial problems with banks due to indebtedness since 2012.The management of that TV channel then decided to stop broadcasting news and all live broadcasts and focused exclusively on recorded content and reruns .The terrestrial broadcasting of "Mega" was terminated by a decision of the distributor on October 28, 2018, and broadcasting on the cable network was suspended one month later. The Mege program is still being broadcast online.
